author: NewsBreak Original
title: Find Shelter from the Cold: Warming Centers Available for Those in Need
text: Winter Weather Safety REGIONAL -- With winter on the way, some people might be in need of somewhere warm to go. Here's a list of warming centers in the area. Tri-City Union Gospel Mission Men's Shelter - 221 S. 4th Avenue. . . 509-547-2112 Women's Shelter - 110 N. 2nd Avenue. . . 509-547-2112 Mid-Columbia Libraries - Pasco 1320 West Hopkins Street, 99301. . . 509-545-1019 First Avenue Center 505 North 1st Avenue, 99301. . . 509-545-3459 Mid-Columbia Libraries - West Pasco 7525 Wrigley Drive, 99301. . . 509-546-8055 Mid-Columbia Libraries - Keewaydin Park 405 South Dayton Street, 99336. . . 509-586-3156 Columbia Center Mall 1321 North Columbia Center Boulevard, 99336. . . 509-783-2108 Mid-Columbia Libraries - Kennewick 1620 South Union Street, 99338. . . 509-783-7878 Richland Public Library 955 Northgate Drive, 99352. . . 509-942-7454 Richland Community Center 500 Amon Drive, 99352. . . 509-942-7529 Mid-Columbia Libraries - West Richland 3203 West Van Giesen Street, 99353. . . 509-967-3191 Becky's Coffee Corner 1120 Meade Avenue, 99350. . . 509-786-0747 Renz Farmers Insurance Agency 1108 Meade Avenue, 99350. . . 509-781-6300 Mid-Columbia Libraries - Prosser 902 7th Street, 99350. . . 509-786-2533 First Congregational Church - Walla Walla 73 S. Palouse Street, 99362. . . 509-301-6848 The Christian Aid Center - Walla Walla 202 W Birch Street, 99362. . . (509) 525-7153 The Walla Walla Public Library - Walla Walla 238 E Alder Street, 99362. . . (509) 527-4550 Mid-Columbia Libraries - Benton City 810 Horne Drive, Benton City, 99320. . . 509-588-6471 Mid-Columbia Libraries - Kahlotus 225 East Weston Street, Kahlotus, 99335. . . 509-282-3493 Mid-Columbia Libraries - Connell 118 North Columbia Avenue, Connell, 99326. . . 509-234-4971 Mid-Columbia Libraries - Basin City 50 North Canal Boulevard A Mesa, 99343. . . 509-269-4201 It recommended to call ahead for business hours during the holiday season. ​COPYRIGHT 2023 BY APPLE VALLEY NEWS NOW. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED. THIS MATERIAL MAY NOT BE PUBLISHED, BROADCAST, REWRITTEN OR REDISTRIBUTED. All five were named as finalists in the National Scholastic Press Association 2023 Broadcast Story of the Year competition.
